item.title: Liza add a quote by Margaret Mitchell
item.description: "My dear, I don't give a damn." -- Margaret Mitchell

item.title: Liza add a quote by Jane Austen
item.description: "The person, be it gentleman or lady, who has not pleasure in a good novel, must be intolerably stupid." -- Jane Austen

item.title: Liza add a quote by Thomas Jefferson
item.description: "I cannot live without books." -- Thomas Jefferson

item.title: Liza add a quote by Joss Whedon
item.description: "Nowadays I’m really cranky about comics. Because most of them are just really, really poorly written soft-core. And I miss good old storytelling. And you know what else I miss? Super powers. Why is it now that everybody’s like “I can reverse the polarity of your ions!” Like in one big flash everybody’s Doctor Strange. I like the guys that can stick to walls and change into sand and stuff. I don’t understand anything anymore. And all the girls are wearing nothing, and they all look like they have implants. Well, I sound like a very old man, and a cranky one, but it’s true." -- Joss Whedon

item.title: Liza add a quote by Garrison Keillor
item.description: "Anyone who thinks sitting in church can make you a Christian must also think that sitting in a garage can make you a car." -- Garrison Keillor

item.title: Liza add a quote by Stephen King
item.description: "Speaking personally, you can have my gun, but you'll take my book when you pry my cold, dead fingers off of the binding." -- Stephen King

item.title: Liza add a quote by Anne Tyler
item.description: "I read so I can live more than one life in more than one place." -- Anne Tyler

item.title: Liza add a quote by C.S. Lewis
item.description: "No book is really worth reading at the age of ten which is not equally – and often far more – worth reading at the age of fifty and beyond." -- C.S. Lewis

item.title: Liza add a quote by C.S. Lewis
item.description: "Eating and reading are two pleasures that combine admirably." -- C.S. Lewis

item.title: Liza add a quote by Charles M. Schulz
item.description: "Nothing takes the taste out of peanut butter quite like unrequited love." -- Charles M. Schulz

item.title: Liza add a quote by Charlotte Brontë
item.description: "I am no bird; and no net ensnares me: I am a free human being with an independent will." -- Charlotte Brontë
